reviews.review: If you like puzzle games this is for you! portal 2 has lots more than the first game.

You just don't have a proper steam account without this game. Its still okay if you don't wanna purchase the game. Still, i very much recommend this game because: 1. This game is nice long game in my opinion. 2. The puzzles are very good and the game introduces a lot of mechanics. That's all i have to say. Goodbye!
its a challenging puzzle game, its pretty funny, and its full of charm
potal
Best puzzle game that has ever been made and it's made by Valve so it's gotta be good

i recommend this game, but if you haven't played portal one and dont want spoilers WAIT TO PLAY IT!  It is a continuation of portal one's story-line (who would've guessed).  If you want to experience with your friends you have to play only portal 2 cuz there is no multiplayer for portal one (my friend and i learned that the hard way D:).  Overall the game is really fun but requires teamwork skills for multiplayer (i am introvert so as you can  imagine this game was hard.  that's kinda what happens when two introverts get in a discord call and play though)

*Note that I have owned this game on console for about 5 years but only just got it on steam*

This is hands down my favourite game of all time, and is arguably one of the most - if not the most -  creative puzzle games ever made. Each puzzle is genuinely challenging and makes you think, and the solutions are mostly very clever. All the jokes land perfectly and the voice acting is incredible (Stephen Merchant is always a win
This game has aged like fine wine, it certainly doesn't feel like it came out 9 years ago.
its just extremley good
An amazing puzzle game that is viewed in the rose tinted glasses of nostalgia, although without playing it before, i can say it's great.

Si te gustÃ³ [i]Portal[/i] no dejes de jugar a [i]Portal 2[/i]: una [b]digna secuela[/b], tambiÃ©n [b]imperdible[/b]! (pero si no jugaste al 1, mejor empezÃ¡ por ahÃ­).

La idea es resolver [b]problemas de ingenio[/b] en primera persona valiÃ©ndonos de un "arma" que dispara [i][b]portales[/b][/i] con los que podremos [i][b]teletransportar[/b][/i] cosas (o a nosotros mismos) de aquÃ­ para allÃ¡ (la misma fÃ³rmula del 1). El objetivo final, nuevamente, es escapar de los laboratorios de [i]Aperture Science[/i] donde nos tienen encerrados para [i]"simplemente"[/i] ponernos a prueba. 

Ideal para los que buscan una experiencia inmersiva donde haya que [b]pensar[/b] un poco, mientras se disfruta de una [b]excelente historia con alto humor irÃ³nico y buen suspenso[/b]. Y todo eso [b]sin matar[/b] a nadie! Bueno, salvo quizÃ¡ a un par robots... pero ellos no estÃ¡n "vivos" lo que se dice "vivos" asÃ­ que podrÃ­a decirse que es un juego [b]sin violencia[/b]! Aunque nosotros sÃ­ podemos llegar a morir de formas bastante violentas, como ser ametrallados, aplastados, quemados, o bombardeados... Â¡justamente por robots! Por eso digo que a veces es mejor matarlos (aunque tÃ©cnicamente no tienen "vida" lo que se dice "vida" asÃ­ que no te sientas mal por eso). 

[i]Portal 2[/i] (al igual que el 1) tiene muy buenos grÃ¡ficos a pesar de sus [b]bajos requerimientos[/b] ya que estÃ¡ hecho con [i][b]Source[/b][/i], el motor de [i]Half-Life 2[/i] (otro juego que recomiendo jugar si acaso aÃºn no lo hiciste). El sonido, la voces, y la mÃºsica tampoco se quedan atrÃ¡s. Y de postre, tras finalizar la [b]campaÃ±a para un jugador[/b], tendremos a nuestra disposiciÃ³n una infinidad de [b]niveles hechos por la comunidad[/b], un [b]editor[/b] para crear los nuestros y compartirlos con el mundo, y el [b]modo cooperativo[/b], en el cual podremos jugar niveles especiales para resolver junto a un amigo.

En resumen: una saga que todo jugador deberÃ­a conocer. 
A no dejarla pasar!
